question: What do you believe should change in Bowling Green/Warren County in order to make it a better place to live, work and spend time?

comments.comment: Smallhouse Rd (at Campbell Ln) heading into town needs to be widened to have room for three lanes (left turn, straight, right turn).
More free meeting space for nonprofits.
After school activity centers for youth with later hours of operation.
More affordable home ownership options.
Better visibility on roads. Reflectors and better signage
The main problem facing is the workforce development. There is over 6500 jobs open in Warren County. This is a big issue.
Create shoulders on the bypass.
Older neighborhoods change from owner occupied to rental.  Deterioration occurs.  Stronger landlord/tenant laws needed!
Cable TV providers should include all local channels.
We need faster internet service.
Emphasize that ALL immigrants should learn and speak ENGLLISH.
Provide accessible transportation for seniors that have difficulty driving
Insist that schools at all levels have daily physical activity  for all students to help combat the childhood obesity crisis.
Provide regular and affordable daily transport to Nashville Airport from Bowling Green.
Hawaii outlaws billboards tokeep the landscape from being blocked I would love to see Bowling Green billboard free
New buildings should not be built right up to the sidewalk to inhibit seeing around corners when driving.
Street lights should be required on residential streets in town. Too many dark corners.
A private (catholic) high school would be beneficial to all.
We must ensure historic preservation codes are properly enforced in our historic districts; lack of consistency erodes our unique aesthetic.
More parking for Fountain Square to become a pedestrian zone.
Build parking garage behind Spencer’s, remove some parking from Ft. Square. Add a green space on top of garage! Soccer field or rooftop food
Solving the drug crisis should not mean people with health problems/injuries have to suffer with severe pain.
Support more local chefs and brewers! White Squirrel is fantastic and I want to see more of it in BG!
Need term limits for all local elected officiałs
Support non-public (or public charter) school choice options, and make choice viable for families of ALL income levels.
There are not enough family-centered activities to do down town.
The Public Library "Internet Café" has become a hangout for the homeless, and this has become an issue the community has chosen to ignore.
Police should not focus on Public Intoxication charges for people walking home. We should encourage people to walk -- not drive drunk.
Parents should be able to send their kids to the school district of their choice no matter where they live in Bowling Green/Warren County.
BGPD needs to work toward community policing, where cops patrol the neighborhoods they live in. Stop incentivizing cops to live in suburbs
Fines and other enforcement actions should be taken against landlords who don't keep up with their properties.
Low-income areas should get beautification money -- not the wealthy who can afford it themselves.
Locally owned, small businesses should get incentives and assistance -- not chains and outside investors.
City officials need to spread resources across city and not just focus on wealthy neighborhoods. Low-income areas of city are ignored.
Businesses and multi-family dwellings should be required to offer and use recycling services.
Recycling services need to be improved and modernized. Current contractor uses outdated equipment, services are messy, company unresponsive.
City and County should convert existing street lighting to Dark Sky Complaint Lights. #Nomoreorangeglow
Judge/prosecutors should not let influential family of victim push extraordinarily harsh sentences & create more victims, ruined young lives
Better/more mass media choices available.
More walking/nature trails in our sports-centric parks. Have certain hours where walkers can enjoy the beauty of Paul Walker Golf Course.
Scottsville Rd should be 4+ lanes between I-65 & Lovers Lane, get rid of the service Rd.
Other counties have school at home on snow days so that kids do not have to make up days.  This should be considered for here.
Community Education provides after-school care necessary to working parents.  Funding should not be cut.
We need a significantly sized public library branch in the southern end of Warren County near South Warren.
Many people want something for nothing and if they don't get it they steal it instead of working for it.  We are producing a gimme society.
Pass a No animals on chains in the county.
Pass a no animals in a hot car ordinance.
Allow parents that take their kids out of public schools to use that money in a private school.
Pass an ordinance that requires pet owners to pay a fee if their pets are not fixed.
Build a homeless park w/tiny homes so they can live & not suffer. There should also be a main house to can receive/organize donations
I believe BGISD and WCS should be combined to lower tax payer overheads of multi-administration wastages
A fine if your cat or dog is picked up as a stray and is not spayed or neutered in the county.
BG needs to develop a marketing campaign to draw Warren Co and surrounding counties to downtown for eating, shopping, and entertainment.
BG needs to redevelop from WKU to the river and beyond. Model after Greenville SC
Bowling Green Government needs more perspective from Millennials. We need ideas for the future not outdated Boomer development ideas.
WRECC should provide internet services.
BGMU needs to be held accountable for their rates and "averages."
There needs to be a stoplight at the intersection of Shive Lane and Ken Bale Blvd to improve traffic flow. The backups there are awful.
24hr parks would be a huge, and relatively inexpensive, benefit for the many people in our community who work 2nd and 3rd shifts.
Bowling Green needs to pass a resolution in support of medical cannabis.
A kayak trail from Lampkin Park to Barren River. Improved River access.
How is it that surrounding counties have county wide high speed internet, yet one third of Warren County residents have slow or no internet?
Greek Life should be monitored on WKU's campus.
There should be more healthy food options near/on campus of WKU.
Bowling Green should have basic zoning mandates in order to beautify decrepit buildings/gravel lawns/general trashiness.
Bowling Green needs more accessible programs for mentorships of young adults and teenagers.
Bowling Green should have more healthy/clean eating options for those who have limited diets.
stronger enforcement of junk cars in yards and trashy looking yards in general
Working folks need ordinances struck down that prevent them from assembling to bargain for better pay. benefits and working conditions.
Doctors over-prescribing opioids should be sentenced at least as harshly as street dealers if not more harshly due to their knowledge.
Doctors who prescribe pain and tranquilizing meds too easily fuel the drug dependency crisis.
American comfort and avoidance of any pain or suffering drives the drug dependency problem.
Individual unhappiness combined with easy legal and illegal availability of drugs drives the opioid crisis.
We need more pet stores
BG needs to increase recycling and trash bins around the parks and parkways to decrease trash and litter
There is too much bullying in our schools that administrators are ignoring.
Bowling Green should be become a carbon neutral city.
The Bowling Green Daily News is too politically slanted.
More weekend activites are needed for YOUNG Seniors, who arent yet ready for Bingo nights.
There should be officers more readily available to the county areas; ex. for domestic violence disputes.
Bowling Green needs more access to affordable , healthy, local food sources.
More gender-neutral bathrooms need to be seen across BG on WKU's campus, in local businesses, etc.
There should be gender-neutral housing options on WKU's campus for LGBTQ+ students.
WKU should open its facilities to the public once or twice a month to the community, and those in need should be welcome more often.
Bowling Green should work on becoming a more food sustainable city with less food waste and food insecurity
A traffic light is needed on Cave Mill in front of Natcher School.  Operational on school days, 7:30 to 9 AM & 3 to 4:30 PM.
For a city of this size, there is too little available in the way of weekend activities for Seniors who are not ready for rocking chairs.
Historic preservation of homes and buildings needs countywide attention to maintain our unique architectural heritage.
More citizens need to be involved in the future development of BG. Too many developers who benefit financially are calling the shots.
Do SOMETHING about completing the "wrap" downtown, or at least enhance (and that includes restaurant service) what is currently there.
Planning & Zoning Board needs an overhaul. Fewer builders appointed, fairness to opposition, stop rubber stamping by P&Z and City Comm.
We need grocery store competition. Kroger doesn't even try because they don't have to. I'm sick of rotten produce. Let's get a Publix!
Commitment to healthy lifestyles
More roundabouts for intersections
Need a better way to work with tenants in the downtown district. Too many come and go because they lack business skills.
More healthy restaurants
Need engaging art installations throughout the city. People will be able to experience art, have fun, and share on social media.
The downtown parking garage has been an eyesore for years. It's embarrassing, so fix it!
Traffic congestion is a major problem, so studying traffic flow closely is the first step.
Concerts and performing arts activities must reflect the diverse racial/ethnic demographic of the city/county.
City/county gov't. (in all of there forms) must reflect the racial/ethnic city/county population demographic to assist in recruitment/growth
Mesonet provides valuable and protective weather information and funding for it should not be cut.
Fountain Square is experiencing an increase in aggressive panhandling, BGPD needs to establish their presence for citizen's safety.
City/county leaders should be cautious of "build it and they will come" mentality for growth and development.
Future charter schools would be a financial burden to public school funding, unless they are held to accountability by local school boards.
Consistent, once a month testing of our emergency sirens, not just before potential bad weather.
You can't get a job in this county at a large place of employment if you have OLD DUI's on your record. This is an un-needed punishment!
Lower taxes by auditing every department for total accountability & make cuts where possible. Stop city government waste.
There should be an actual complaint filed by a neighbor before Code Enforcement writes a violation. Stop harassing hardworking citizens.
The very low number of immigrants coming to our county last year was a good thing. Saves costs: Schools, courts, social services-Our taxes!
Bowling Green needs a stronger separation of church-mosque-temple and state.
People should not be allowed to bring their pets every place or store they go to.
Bowling Green needs more pet-friendly housing options for renters.
There should be no punishment for small amounts of marijuana possession, in my opinion
Bowling Green needs more cultural and educational establishments, like sciemce, history and art museums.
Require businesses to pick up litter they and their customers generate.
Louisville rd area needs more businesses and restaurants extending out towards the factories to also bring in revenue from Edmonson Co.
Warren county needs to be more proactive about keeping their county maps up to date of new roads or developments especially online. (Google)
It should be mandatory for all homes/businesses to have visible marking on mailbox and building for their address.
Expand Nashville Rd all the way past Chaney’s & Buchanan park.  Very dangerous area.. very much so for a school area & young drivers.
The LEFT turning light at Nashville onto Dishman & the same for Scottsville onto Lovers Ln.. need to be longer to allow more to go through.
Need a traffic signal on Cave Mill in front of Natcher School, operating 8-9 AM, 3:30-4:30.
We need to SHADE street lamps. This actually increases visibility, reduces glare, and saves energy/ money. Using LEDs would save money, too.
Local companies that can't fill job openings should recruit from parts of KY w/ high unemployment & pay relocation expenses.
Companies that claim they cannot fill job openings should raise wages and improve working conditions.
Local companies that can't fill job openings & the Workforce Dev't. Board should set up commuter lots and a shuttle service to rural areas.
BGDN should publish each month the number of job positions filled / people employed through the Workforce Development Board’s efforts.
Bowling Green should consider a program, like Ft Worth Texas's Clean Slate, in which the homeless can earn money by cleaning up the city.
BGDN should publish these BGPD stats weekly – 1) traffic citations 2) vehicle accidents reported; 3) traffic accidents resulting in injury.
The city & county school districts need to be re-evaluated The yards/houses that touch Potter Grays playground r all County school districts
animal cruelty laws need to exist and be enforced
fines for leaving dog feces in public areas needs to be enforced
there should be a tenant/landlord grievance department with legal assistance
Wal-Mart and Kroger grocery pick-up should have to accept EBT for the elderly and disabled
we need transit buses for elderly and disabled in the county and they should be easy to enter and exit/wheelchair accessible
apartment complexes should be required to participate in recycling program
the Bark Park needs more trees and water access for the smaller dogs area
Farmers shouldn’t need a permit to build a fence.
Planning and zoning laws should change to encourage small businesses and farms.
City Annexed areas need more city services for their tax $$.
Whenever land is bought by the city/county, the seller and amount sold for needs to be transparent, rather than “LLC” as listed seller.
We need well planned service roads, instead of so many driveways directly on streets like Campbell Lane and the By pass.
We should have a commuting service between here & Nashville.
Fireworks use in residential areas is out of control with no police presence to enforce the already in place restrictions.
Parking  on both sides of the streets  in apartment subdivisions should  should not be allowed  and police need to enforce the law.
Parking in apartment subdivisions  should monitored closely by police. Parking on subdivision streets shouldn't be allowed.
Owners of large parking lots should be required to break them up with pockets of green space and trees; perhaps create a walkable green path
Make Scott Waste follow their contract - Return trash cans next to the house and not leave them on the sidewalks.  Keep BG clean!
Schools should provide an opportunity for nonswimming parent/guardians to have water safety and swimming lessons in private setting.
Water safety and swim lessons to all k-12 students.
Greenwood Mall parking lot could become a cooperative solar collection for itself and home surrounding
We need a 6 day a week farmer's market that is open at least 5 hours -
Legalizing marijuana at the state level could produce substantial tax revenue, but if only BG did, it would cause problems.
Connect business parking lots to reduce unnecessary traffic on main roadways
Higher education is intended to help young people develop into informed, well-rounded citizens who contribute positively to society.
Animated digital business signs are a road hazard. They distract drivers.
All new and existing sidewalks should have shade trees
Indoor swimming pools for public use and therapy year around without time restrictions due to special swim leagues. Encourage healthier life
Highway exits spur development, which would likely lead to undesireable suburban sprawl.
Bowling Green  has been monopolized by Houchens.  Limit their growth they own too much of the city for it to be fair to other businesses
Recycling should be encouraged by not charging for the service
We need to replace "Room at the Inn" services with temporary decent housing connected to aid agencies for the homeless
Every citizen should be within 1 mile of some shaded green space.
Every new apartment building should have shaded parklike space for refreshment of its tenants
We need to carefully preserve agricultural land
Better enforcement of traffic violations. Too many running red lights, parking in fire lanes, cell phone usage while driving
Better public transit and runs 24 /7 so people without cars can get to work. Also more stops added in residential areas.
Minimum wage needs to go o $15 per hour
All new and existing single family housing should have at least one shade tree planting
Shade trees should be required plantings along all Greenways
We need more incentives for individual and business solar power
Urban sprawl in Bowling Green is a major problem that has made this city less walking/bike friendly.
Increase Internet/Cell/Phone service throughout the county.  First deal with areas that currently don't have any option.
No business should get tax credit without paying  workers at least $10 per hour plus benefits that would increase that to minimum of $15.
I should be allowed to plant flowers in my own yard where ever i want them.
Too much money is spent on making sure we cut our grass and don't park in the yard.
BG can’t compete with Nashville or Louisville for young professionals
Please increase more family friendly activities
City officials need to work with WKU admin. to address the noise & public nuisance problems with the frat houses and homeowners downtown.
Need to build wider access roads into the city!
Don't waste $800,000 of tax dollars for a fountain in Lamkin park. Residents would be better served with educational programs for the youth!
Reduce and/or get rid of the city wage tax.
Build more roads!!! Traffic is terrible here for a small city.
Need comprehesive probation rehab programs - include addiction treatment, life & job skills & ideas securing housing, training/job etc
Overdevelopment of rental property is detrimental to cities.  Renters do not pay property tax.  Schools suffer when the tax base is eroded.
Require 4 yr HS lifeskills class, how to: family finance, file tax, repair/maintain car, repair/maintain home, cook/sew, apply/interview job
We need a fiber option for internet.
When the city tears up lawns with projects they should be required to do what it takes so that lawns are same quality they were before.
I see a lot of folks with expired tags on cars, both in state and out of state. Police need to enforce the laws and write more tickets.
install traffic cameras and enforce running of stop lights. more traffic enforcement means more $$$ for the city.
Police do a shameful job of enforcing traffic laws. more tickets = more compliance and more $$$$$.
Either do the speed limit or get over to the right, to many SLOW, out of county drivers clogging up the roadways.
people need to understand that a STOP sign means STOP, not just slow down and keep going.
Oversight committees for projects such as TIF. Elected officials should not be able to sit on unelected boards.
Regulate the size & brightness of business signs.
Plan for people, not cars. Walking should be enjoyable, not a hazard.
Consider asking low-income or disabled residents what they really need.
Build parking areas.
Create pedestrian-only streets.
A fresh food grocery store to be built in Delafield and Morgantown rd areas within walking distance of residents.
It should not take 3 months to get a gynecologist appointment in this city.
Traffic and toxic vehicle dependency should NOT be a topic of priority for this city.
We need mixed-use development in the most disadvantaged areas of BG.
We need more mixed-use developments so people live closely to all basic needs. Mix business and residential zones and increase walkability.
Term limits should be initiated on county executives.
Affordable supports for the elderly and aging population are needed in our community.
Reducing poverty will enhance the quality of life for everyone in our community regardless of status.
many parts of the By-pass can and should be widened
There should be more opportunities for the arts and sciences in the Housing Authority so the students there can rise above!
Need new schools in Warren County to keep up with population growth, CTE is falling down, Drakes and Greenwood high are way overcrowded
Apartments for 55 and older that are upscale and lovely.
Bowling Green needs more indoor sports facilities, particularly a large complex with multiple indoor soccer fields, for youth.
BGMU needs to offer residential fiber internet as a UTILITY, using Chattanooga as a perfect example.
Public school could do alternate teaching styles(like Montessori) in a school within a school set up.  Not all kids learn the same way.
High sugar items like pop tarts and chocolate muffins should not be a part of the public school breakfast menu
some children with cultural differences or dietary needs cannot eat a typical lunch at school please provide special diet options.
Emergency protective orders should not be able to be obtained regarding claims of an incident from a year ago.
Too many apartments in Plano. Nice little country setting I bought my home in forever ruined!
The intersection of Scottsville road and entrance to Greenview Hospital needs to be widened
Mandatory, expensive fines should be implemented for littering and illegal dumping.
BG police should improve officer training and should be held accountable for abuse of power.
A senior living community, designed for 50+ residents rather than 75+ & in failing health residents, is needed — and apparently ignored.
Should be an interstate exit for the Woodburn area it could help decrease BG congestion and let people bypass BG all together
There are no public adult swim facilities in Bowling Green for year around physical use. The Lovers Lane Complex should be made available
The rental market prices are well beyond an affordable housing level and needs to be addressed given the number of renters in BG.
BG needs an indoor tennis option
BG needs to install traffic cameras that help police intersections like Gallatin, TN.  This would reduce accidents, traffic flow and add $
Allow residence of an area to vote on new developments that might have impact on them opposed to commissioners/magistrates getting kickbacks
Temporary housing for the homeless in the community.
Bowling Green needs an indoor / outdoor sports event complex/
Bowling Green would be better if it didn't have the "Good Ole Boy" system among so many.
City residents do not receive adequate return on County Taxes paid.
Five lane Cemetery Road from Interchange to By Pass, except four lanes through the Cemetery with median prohibiting left turns.
More parking downtown.  There are too many reserved spaces which should be available in the evening.
Legalized Marijuana will not only assist Bowling Green in earning Tax revenue but will decrease the strain on our prison system. Win-Win.
The speed limit on WKU campus should be increased from 15 miles per hour to 25 miles per hour.
Provide a food assistance program for college students as students lots of times do not qualify for food stamps due to living on campus
Birth control should be an OTC drug- access to it in Kentucky and in Bowling Green is limited for many women.
If people are suggesting more advertising for tourists, there needs to be things for tourists to do.
We need more regulation of opioid drugs, both prescribed and illicit.
Promote access to mental health treatment, rather than treating addicts as criminals.
Sex education should include information about consent, safe sex practices, and STD spread and prevention.
We need to offer free full panel STD testing to students and low income families
We need more Community Farming Programs(where you pay farmers money up front and during harvest you get fresh fruits/veggies, eggs, etc)
There should be more cooperation between WKU and Bowling Green, especially for things like internships and community involvement.
There need to be harsher punishments for WKU campus rapes/sexual assaults.
In order to combat teen pregnancy and STD rates, high schools in Bowling Green should offer comprehensive, medically accurate sex education.
We need more activities/places to go for teenagers; basically all there is are places to eat, the mall, and the bowling alley
City schools should be redistricted to more evenly distribute the kids.
There should be more effort put into teaching students about any potential harmful side effects of drugs, illegal or otherwise.
The bypass area must be developed and utilized for new businesses and attractive structures. It is a neglected area that is losing business.
There should be a push to improve mental health awareness and availability in Bowling Green.
Educate high schoolers on their options after they graduate
The area of downtown and the riverfront should continue to be developed for entertainment and recreation for both day and night activities.
More creative learning classes
Schools should offer more comprehensive sexual education to help lower STD and teen pregnancy rates.
We need to renovate the run down businesses and store fronts, instead of building new places
Sewer should be required to be run to all new subdivisions and cost should be split between city/county water systems and builders
More green spaces. All of our parks have just become sports complexes!
I should be allowed to keep my yard & home in any manner I please.
Make areas around WKU's campus livable for college students. Eliminating section 8 housing will lead to less crime & lower cost of attendance.
A way to improve Bowling Green and the surrounding areas is to improve traffic flow & circulation by limiting the number of traffic lights.
Free WIFI in certain areas - particularly around Fountain Squre
Drivers tests in BG should test over the rules of a turnabout.
Better parking around the square would draw in more college students who like to shop but can not find parking downtown.
More local produce should be incorporated into public school's lunchrooms
Drug information classes should be given to incoming freshmen of WKU to educate them about the risks and health hazards.
There needs to be better access to grocery stores and restaurants from WKU's campus.
All public schools should have an adequate summer feeding program so no child goes hungry.
Arts education should be available in every school in Warren County and other surrounding areas.
Public school systems need to provide more funding for art education programs, such as music, theater, and visual arts.
Resources to better integrate immigrants and refugees into the community should be put into place.
Parking on the WKU campus should be more accessible to students and visitors.
NO to the "Fairness" Ordinance. Current law is sufficient.  ZERO reported instances where LGBTQ people have been discriminated against in BG
Recruit and retain the best k-13 teachers graduating from WKU
Vaping should not be added to the smoking ordinance.
Smoking should not be allowed in public parks.
Smoking should not be allowed within 25 feet of a business.
The city of Bowling Green should enforce their existing noise ordinance.
More sidewalks would be great, but first let’s stop people parking on them.  Or stop spending money building them.  Whichever.
Institutionalize racism is alive and well here. I know because I have experienced it first hand. We need to have a plan.
The Smokey Bones entrance off of Scottsville Road is extremely dangerous and needs a traffic light.
Bowling Green is an excellent place to raise a family, shop, worship, get an education, and recreate. I feel safe in most places here in BG.
Too many trees have been torn down to make way for new developments. We should re-plant more trees around Bowling Green.
Junking up highways/roadways with signs should not be the primary way tourism is promoted.
BG Parks needs more funding  from City
City School taxes are too high , they need to budget more
Trick or treating should last longer after dark. Many decorations don't show til then. Also start later, parents can't get home in time!
There should never be a leash law in the county - neighborhood dogs protect, play with and teach kids. It was a factor in living in county.
An unmanned trolley system, possibly solar, might be better long term than buses for some areas.
I wish we had train service to Nashville
I think we have enough restaurants.
Casinos. Bring them here.
We need an NBA team. I think we should put the arena where the airport is. Think about it.
Houston "courtesy police" maintain safety on access rds enforcing right of way & parking/litter rules, assist traffic flow - we need!
The airport should be moved to the transpark.
One should not be able to literally "buy" their way into ability to vote in an election in a locality they do not live in.  $ don't buy vote
Extra police, or parking enforcement unit should be on duty during events to maintain legal parking
Take advantage of the wonderful summers in KY and have more outdoor public swimming spaces
Multi-use sidewalks should have fixtures for skateboards, bikes like small ramps etc.
Make all future sidewalks wide enough for multi-use (walking, biking, skateboarding etc)
People want it all, without paying for anything. A healthy community requires taxes people.
Some county roads, such as Hammett Hill Road, are so narrow it's hard for two cars to pass. Surely they could make them a little wider.
city needs to work on water run off when we have a lot of rain.. to many places flood on roadways makes driving very dangerous..
With drug use being so prevalent in Warren county, better treatment options need to be offered.
Most drugs except meth should be free & government controlled. See Belgium.
Some of the roads in the city are not wide enough to put sidewalks in but they do anyway catherine dr is ridiculous
Local fuel prices need to investigated.
Refugees should be required to learn and speak english.
WKU should consider building a parking structure at the Chestnut St lot.
The Bowling Green/Warren County Airport needs to be relocated outside of the city limits.
The Barren River water front needs to be improved on both sides of the river and include  canoeing and kayaking water features in the river.
Bowling Green is in need of an ice rink for recreation and sport.
Traffic congestion on Fairview Ave and Cemetery Rd needs to be improved during evening rush hours.
Footbridge from airport to across the street. Pilots running across the road.
Go to underground utilities. Scottsville rd and the by-pass look awful.
Local food and small farms are one of BG best attractions.
BG can link/support hotel/food, recreational/cultural venues in a Tourism Passport, giving discounts when at least 3 are purchased together.
Bowling Green needs ev car charging stations. There are none available unless you own a Tesla.
Recycling centers should be moved out of town.
There should be more officers observing intersections.
I feel Bowling Green could benefit with an additional ambulance service.  Quicker response, and possibly a lower payment when used.
Work needs to be done on improving litter pick up and encouraging people dispose of their litter correctly.
competition for cable companies and an end to heir price gouging.
Recycling services need to be expanded & improved. With growing population, think of how much land will become dump sites...Ridiculous!
Planning & Zoning need to do a better job of listening & working with residents. It's not next to their house, so they don't care!
Parking lots should be monitored to prevent illegal parking in handicap spaces.
The money I earn & spend is all done within the city limits but as a county resident I have NO voice/vote in city politics. Needs to change!
There should be something a work farm for local prisoners to learn to tend gardens, take care of livestock, and learn to be more useful.
Our city should make a bid for Google Fiber to help compete with Spectrum and AT&T.
There are intersections such as the access road along Scottsville that to be reworked, possibly into roundabout or similar designs.
Spectrum should have competition and not a monopoly. Rates should be regulated by city county government
If we cut a major program, WKU would lose in the revenue the program brings in, ultimately costing more money.
parks and rec should promote and support pickleball for older citizens
The entire bypass area is an eyesore and there needs to be a concerted effort like a TIF to revitalize this crucial part of town.
Bowling Green should try to emulate Owensboro's Friday night programs downtown.
Driving in this town very dangerous, Drivers Education classes should be required for all new drivers!!!
Many drivers fail to stop as traffic lights turn red.  As many as 3 cars will travel through an intersection after light has changed to red.
The feeder road at Shive Lane and Scottsville Road need to be closed off. It is very dangerous.
New developments should help pay to widen the roads in the areas where they are increasing traffic.
city officials might look into layoff practices on jobs in bowling green ky
if there was a law for employers to pay back on bad layoffs and cutbacks
Bike lanes that are wide enough to safely ride on without fear of being hit by passing cars.
We need urban planning to ensure that mixed use housing, shopping and new neighborhoods are created to make our community better
I hope BG can one day link the short, scattered bicycle paths.
big projeck in city sould be vote by people
Job training programs for lower income
Encourage connection between the wealthy and the poor
More public transportation options--be creative
Higher minimum wage
Improved businesses such as banks and groceries in lowest income areas
Arts-based charter schools
Post-secondary training programs for special education students.
More technical education programs for non-graduates of high school
Rental assistance programs
Busy roads like the by pass either need turn lanes or block left hand turns except at stop lights.
BG needs more Summer weekend festivals/activities
Make it a walking city. Sidewalks along the main avenues (scottsville rd, campbell ln, 31 bypass) with plants, benches, art pieces.
When you prioritize the safety of people over automobile speed, all kinds of positive things happen. #slowthecars
Shopping should be spread across all four corners of the county, so the traffic on Scottsville rd and Campbell lane will be improved.
Some local doctors order too many tests.
With jails crowded, it seems many are first time offenders of crimes that hurt no one, nor property. Seems rehab would be better.
Develop a manufacturing Work training program for jail inmates that qualify
Funding and support should be given to the existing BG buses, to expand their service area and improve accessibility.
Rental property taxes should be reduced for private landlords to encourage them to develop more, as opposed to large ones like Chandler.
We need to focus more on the existing housing in BG, including renovations and improvements.
District judges are biased towards large local companies to the detriment of individuals.
Invest in the youth.
Actually teach HS students useful things.
7% of Paker-Bennett &  3.7% of Bristow homeless. I will pay 6 cents per $100 income to end homelessness for school-age families via Apt. $
City had 109 homeless students in 2017, County Had 112.  Housing those families temporarily is worth raising tax rate from 1.85% to 1.91%.
I would love to see a Texas Roadhouse in Bowling Green
Bowling Green has many excellent non-public schools; more should be done to make these options available to diverse and low-income families.
The Fairness Ordinance, as currently proposed, poses insufficient protection for religious conscience and should be revised accordingly.
Internet services should be a public municipality.
